title: Alex Clare: The singer who chose his faith over Adele tour
description: Alex Clare on record label ultimatums and a hopeful return to a kinder music industry.

title: Who is the redhead living in the Tower of London?
description: It's true a Beefeater's daughter lives within the ancient walls - but this redhead is no blue-blood.

title: Covid: Charlize Theron wants fairer distribution of vaccines
description: The actress tells the BBC nations must start sharing jabs to help reach the WHO's vaccination goals.

title: Malkhan Singh: The surrender of India's bandit king
description: Forty years ago, a photographer spent a week following India's dreaded "bandit king" Malkhan Singh.

title: Life at 50C: Surviving in Kuwait's 'unbearable' heat
description: The Middle East is warming faster than much of the world, leaving Kuwaitis struggling with everyday life.

title: Ros Atkins on... India's climate challenge
description: A look at how India is trying to balance banishing poverty with meeting its climate commitments.

title: Girls Night In: 'Spiking is part of going out - so we're staying in'
description: Campaigners say the situation has reached "boiling point" and venues need to do more to keep them safe.

title: Lutalo Muhammad: Why I’m proud to be black and British
description: Two-time Olympic taekwondo medallist Lutalo Muhammad writes about the importance of Black History Month.

title: Julian Assange: WikiLeaks founder's extradition appeal explained
description: The US begins its appeal in order to extradite the WikiLeaks founder. We explain how we got here.

title: Latvia 0-10 England: Lionesses maintain 100% record in Women's World Cup qualifying
description: England maintain their 100% record in qualifying for the Women's World Cup as they put 10 past Latvia in Riga.

title: T20 World Cup - Pakistan v New Zealand: New Zealand's Devon Conway makes sensational diving catch
description: Watch as New Zealand's Devon Conway makes a brilliant diving catch at the boundary to remove Pakistan's Mohammad Hafeez at the T20 World Cup.

title: Charlottesville: Why are the ‘Unite the Right’ organisers on trial?
description: Nine people injured at the 2017 far-right 'Unite the Right' rally in Virginia are suing organisers.

title: Exclusive images of extradition of Manchester bomber's brother
description: Watch as Hashem Abedi, the brother of the Manchester Arena bomber, is sent to Britain for trial.

title: Drone captures sewage pumped into sea for days
description: A photographer captures a pipe pumping filtered sewage into Langstone Harbour in Hampshire.

title: Owen Paterson faces 30-day Commons suspension for rule breach after watchdog report
description: A report says ex-minister Owen Paterson had used his position as MP to benefit two companies who paid him.

title: T20 World Cup - South Africa v West Indies: Evin Lewis scores 56 runs off 35 balls
description: Watch as Evin Lewis hits a brilliant 56 off 35 balls, including six sixes, for the West Indies against South Africa at the T20 World Cup.

title: No VAT cut to household energy bills in the Budget
description: Treasury sources say such a move would be badly targeted and there are other ways to help those struggling.

title: Can Lego help save Singapore's coral reefs?
description: Scientists in Singapore are using the popular building block in an effort to rejuvenate its reefs.

title: South Africa's De Kock withdraws from West Indies game after refusing to take knee
description: Quinton de Kock makes himself unavailable for South Africa's T20 World Cup match against West Indies after refusing to take the knee.

title: Louise Minchin: Man admits stalking BBC presenter
description: Carl Davies admits sending intimidating comments to Louise Minchin and her adult daughter.

title: New funding plan paves way for Sizewell C nuclear plant
description: The new rules, to be announced in Parliament, will boost the prospects of the £20bn project in Suffolk.

title: Climate change: Make people fly less, ministers told
description: The government must cut demand for flying and meat under plans to curb climate change, experts say.

title: Japan's Princess Mako: The woman who gave up royal status to marry
description: Japan's Princess Mako has finally married her college sweetheart, thus losing her royal status.

title: Budget 2021: What has already been announced?
description: Rishi Sunak's statement isn't until Wednesday, but several pledges have been announced.

title: Whyte rubbishes claims he faked injury & wants to fight Fury next
description: Dillian Whyte says he hopes to fight WBC champion Tyson Fury next, and rubbishes claims he faked injury to pull out of his bout against Otto Wallin.

title: Why women may wait decades for an ADHD diagnosis
description: At least tens of thousands in the UK, it is estimated, are not receiving the help they need.

title: Rangers great Walter Smith dies at age 73
description: Walter Smith, one of Rangers' most successful managers and who had spells in charge of Everton and Scotland, has died at the age of 73.

title: Animal rights activists scale Home Office building
description: Police look on as four activists from Animal Rebellion are seen climbing the building in Westminster.

title: Budget 2021: Public sector workers set for pay rise, says Sunak
description: The chancellor will use his Budget on Wednesday to confirm that the "pay pause" is being lifted.

title: 'We're being pressured into sex by some trans women'
description: Some lesbians say they have been called transphobic for not wanting sex and relationships with trans women.

title: Japan's Princess Mako finally marries commoner boyfriend Kei Komuro
description: She will lose her royal status and has declined a $1.3m payment for leaving the family.

title: Prince Andrew: Deadline set for depositions in sex assault civil case
description: The two sides have until 14 July 2022 to submit sworn testimony in the civil case, a US judge rules.

title: Oil tanker runs aground off Isle of Wight
description: The tanker was en route to Egypt when it became wedged on a shingle bank off The Needles.

title: Afro hair comb inventor hopes to inspire young black women
description: Youmna Mouhamad hopes more young black women "feel heard and accepted" and get into engineering.

title: Noni Madueke: The English teenager who rejected English giants to star for PSV Eindhoven
description: Noni Madueke has not had as much media attention as some other young English talents but he is attracting interest from Europe's biggest clubs.

title: Manchester Arena bomber Salman Abedi's parents living in Libya
description: Ramadan Abedi and his wife Samia Tabbal are under surveillance by Libyan authorities, the BBC confirms.

title: The Papers: End to pay freeze and Facebook 'in the dock'
description: Many of the papers focus on Wednesday's Budget, including plans to scrap a public sector pay freeze.

title: Eco-friendly sex: What is it and how does it impact on climate change?
description: As more people try to live environmentally friendly lives, how do we make sex more sustainable?

title: Chappelle slams cancel culture amid Netflix transgender furore
description: "I am not bending to anybody's demands," says the US comic of the transgender backlash he faces.

title: 'Why I returned to Boko Haram and how I escaped'
description: Aisha Yerima, who was kidnapped aged 21, tells of her time living with militants in Nigeria.

title: Fleeing Afghanistan: 'Women are imprisoned, while the criminals are free'
description: When Afghanistan fell, hundreds of female judges went into hiding. After months living in fear, 26 have escaped.
